javadoc: Class for accumulating bytes into an automatically expanding buffer with an explicit upper limit to the size

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create the buffer specifying its initial and limiting capacity

params.name: initial
params.comment: is the number of bytes to be initially allocated for the buffer

params.name: amax
params.comment: is the absolute maximum number of bytes the buffer is allowed to expand to before throwing exceptions

methods.name: append
methods.comment:
Append a byte into the buffer.  The buffer's internal storage is expanded as necessary, but only up to
 the specified maximum. If this append exceeds that maximum, then an exception is thrown

methods.name: getInputStream
methods.comment:
Generate an InputStream from the bytes that have been appended to the buffer
 The buffer is NOT copied

name: LimitedByteBuffer
comment: Class for accumulating bytes into an automatically expanding buffer with an explicit upper limit to the size
